questions.text: I need a lot of alone time to recharge my social battery.
I believe couples should share all of their bank accounts and finances.
When we argue, I prefer to walk away and cool down before talking.
I am completely comfortable with silence when we are hanging out together.
I care more about celebrating big milestones (anniversaries, birthdays) than small daily gestures.
I think it is important for partners to have completely separate hobbies.
I am the type of person who likes to have every detail of a vacation planned out.
I would rather spend money on a memorable experience than a physical item.
Keeping the house perfectly clean and organized is a top priority for me.
I am very comfortable initiating conversations about physical intimacy and our sex life.
I prefer sticking to a comfortable routine over spontaneous, last-minute plans.
I feel completely comfortable being my weirdest, most unfiltered self around you.
I believe flirting with other people is harmless as long as it doesn't go further.
I rely heavily on my partner to help me make big life decisions.
I would be willing to relocate to a new city or country for my partner's dream job.
I feel incredibly loved when my partner takes over my household chores.
I have a hard time letting go of grudges after a major disagreement.
I think it's healthy for couples to occasionally go to bed angry.
I am completely transparent with my partner about my current financial debts and spending.
I prefer our weekends to be packed with social events and seeing friends.
I believe pets are equal members of the family.
I am very quick to apologize when I know I am in the wrong.
I expect my partner to be my absolute best friend.
I would rather cook a meal together at home than go out to a fancy restaurant.
I feel perfectly secure when my partner spends the evening out with their friends.
I get annoyed when my partner is on their phone during meals or quality time.
I think it is important to spend holidays with extended family rather than just the two of us.
I am comfortable letting my partner choose what we watch on TV most of the time.
I believe we divide household chores fairly.
I prefer to vent about a bad day rather than have my partner try to fix the problem.
I am highly ambitious and career-driven.
I believe it is important to check in with each other via text throughout the workday.
I feel comfortable sharing my phone passcode with my partner.
I like receiving frequent physical affection (hugs, kisses, hand-holding) throughout the day.
I handle constructive criticism from my partner well.
I prioritize staying physically fit and healthy.
I enjoy hosting parties and having people over to our home.
I get stressed easily when our plans change at the last minute.
I think a shared sense of humor is one of the most important parts of a relationship.
I feel a strong need to impress my partner's friends and family.
I am a naturally jealous person in romantic relationships.
I prefer sleeping with the room completely dark and cold.
I believe in maintaining a strict budget for our personal spending.
I would rather receive a thoughtful, handmade gift than an expensive store-bought one.
I feel comfortable discussing my past relationships with my current partner.
I think it is perfectly fine to have close friends of the gender I am attracted to.
I consider myself to be the more practical and logical one in this relationship.
I enjoy engaging in deep, philosophical conversations.
I am someone who needs a clear plan for where we will be in 5 to 10 years.
I easily notice when my partner is feeling stressed or down.
I prefer to tackle the most difficult tasks first thing in the morning.
I believe strongly in traditional gender roles within a household.
I feel very anxious when we are running late for an event.
I would rather confront a stranger being rude than let it slide.
I believe going to couples counseling is a healthy tool, not a sign of failure.
I feel a strong connection to my spiritual or religious beliefs.
I like to dress up and look my best, even for casual outings.
I am very good at keeping secrets.
I think couples should always vote for the same political candidates.
I prefer to take the lead in planning our date nights.
I frequently experience 'FOMO' (Fear Of Missing Out) when I stay in.
I find it easy to admit when I am feeling vulnerable or scared.
I believe keeping a little bit of mystery keeps a relationship exciting.
I enjoy taking risks, whether in business, finances, or recreation.
I expect my partner to defend me in public, even if I am wrong.
I prefer living in a bustling city over a quiet rural area.
I am a very nostalgic person who holds onto keepsakes and memories.
I think it is important to establish boundaries with our parents/in-laws.
I feel energized after a long workout.
I love discovering and trying new foods and cuisines.
I am comfortable letting my partner drive when we are in the car together.
I find public displays of affection (PDA) embarrassing.
I believe life is too short to work a job I don't love, even if it pays well.
I consider myself a perfectionist in almost everything I do.
I need my partner to verbally tell me they love me every single day.
I prefer to buy groceries in bulk rather than making frequent small trips.
I am very affected by the mood and energy of the people around me.
I think social media is generally harmful to relationships.
I would rather hire a professional for home repairs than try to do it myself.
I actively try to learn new things and expand my skills.
I enjoy playing board games or video games as a way to connect.
I have a difficult time saying 'no' when people ask me for favors.
I believe the spark in a relationship requires constant, intentional effort.
I am the more spontaneous one in our relationship.
I care deeply about keeping up with current events and the news.
I prefer having a few very close friends over a large group of acquaintances.
I tend to overthink conversations after they have happened.
I believe taking separate vacations from each other occasionally is healthy.
I enjoy giving advice when someone comes to me with a problem.
I feel that our current work-life balance is exactly where it needs to be.
I enjoy being the center of attention in a room full of people.
I am very strict about my personal morning routine.
I believe that 'white lies' are sometimes necessary to spare someone's feelings.
I feel comfortable asking my partner to change a habit that bothers me.
I would rather have a quiet night reading or watching a movie than go to a loud bar.
I think it is important to celebrate Valentine's Day.
I handle physical pain or sickness very well without complaining.
I believe true love means never having to hide your flaws.
I am motivated more by the fear of failure than the desire for success.
I like to listen to loud music while I clean or work.
I am someone who holds on to items 'just in case' I need them later.
I think sharing passwords to social media accounts is a sign of trust.
I prefer my living space to be minimalist with very little clutter.
I enjoy engaging in friendly, competitive banter with my partner.
I believe everything happens for a reason.
I am generally an optimistic person who looks on the bright side.
I think it is important to dress up nicely when going to the airport.
I would rather cook breakfast together than go out for brunch.
I value my partner's opinion more than my friends' opinions.
I enjoy spending time outdoors in nature (hiking, camping, etc.).
I am comfortable discussing my deepest fears with my partner.
I prefer to resolve arguments through written communication (text/letter).
I believe that opposites attract and make the best couples.
I care a lot about the brand names of the clothes and items I buy.
I feel more productive when I am working under a tight deadline.
I think it's important to have dedicated 'date nights' scheduled in advance.
I get frustrated when things don't go exactly according to my plan.
I enjoy exploring museums and historical sites while on vacation.
I am comfortable letting my partner manage all of our investments.
I believe that communication is more important than physical intimacy in a relationship.
I prefer watching documentaries over fictional movies.
I think children should be raised with strict rules and discipline.
I enjoy surprising my partner with unexpected gifts or gestures.
I have a difficult time relaxing when there are chores left undone.
I value honesty over politeness in almost every situation.
I am comfortable crying in front of my partner.
I believe that a person's career defines a large part of who they are.
I prefer to spend the holidays at home rather than traveling.
I think it is okay to keep small secrets from your partner.
I enjoy being the one to drive when we take road trips.
I believe that watching reality TV is a great way to unwind.
I am very mindful of my environmental impact and carbon footprint.
I think it is important to regularly try new things outside of my comfort zone.
I prefer to shower at night rather than in the morning.
I am completely satisfied with how we divide mental load (planning, remembering dates, etc.).
I enjoy participating in intense physical activities or extreme sports.
I believe it is important to give back to the community through volunteering.
I find it easy to fall asleep quickly at night.
I think it is crucial to agree on major political issues as a couple.
I am the type of person who reads the book before watching the movie adaptation.
I believe that saving for retirement is more important than traveling right now.
I enjoy debating topics just for the sake of the intellectual exercise.
I feel deeply connected to my cultural heritage or family roots.
I prefer texting to calling when I need to ask a quick question.
I am comfortable letting my partner pick out clothes for me.
I believe our relationship has made me a better person.
I feel that we spend enough quality, distraction-free time together.
I trust my partner completely and unconditionally.
I am excited and optimistic about our shared future.
I feel truly understood and seen by my partner.
